feed.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Lip Gloss
feed.subtitle: We put some popular brands of lip gloss to the test. Find out which ones shone bright – and which ones made our puckers pout.

content.div:
We put some popular brands of lip gloss to the test. Find out which ones shone bright – and which ones made our puckers pout.



NARS (Suggested retail price: $24; available at NARS and Holt Renfrew)

“This gloss’ colour is durable, but the same can’t be said of its shine -- even compared to the cheapest of this bunch. That's a shocker considering its ooey-gooey texture -- so thick I wondered whether my lips would wind up literally sealed. (A guerilla precaution against bad word-of-mouth, perhaps?) Rating: 2/5” –Leah Collins

“The first shade I tried was a winner for the ‘wow’ factor alone – it’s called ‘Nana’ and the colour in the tube appears to be jet-black. It goes on a little lighter (think deep plum) but it’s still dark enough to make a bold statement – which is not what you’d expect from a gloss. I had much less fun with the next shade, the unfortunately named ‘Super Orgasm.’ It’s light pink and has sparkles (which seemed to last much longer than both the colour and the shine, leaving my lips covered in uneven glittery bits). Overall, though, I was impressed with the thick texture of the Nars gloss, and the staying power of the darker shades. Rating: 3/5” –Jen McDonnell

“I loved the texture of this product, which left me feeling like I was actually wearing more than a gloss. The hues were rich but the shine factor was definitely lacking. I fell in love with a dark shade but had to add a coat of another type of gloss on top to obtain a shiny pout. Rating 3/5” –Miranda Furtado


Hard Candy Plexi Gloss (Suggested retail price: $4; available at Wal-Mart)

“My make-up bag is perpetually choked with assorted, cheap-o squeeze-tube glosses -- a girl could make worse impulse buys -- and Hard Candy's Plexi Gloss is just one more to add to the pile: no better, no worse. You'll get a burst of lacquered shine -- albeit without the same even coverage as the more chi-chi glosses tested here. Just expect to apply, and re-apply, and re-apply until you've developed some sort of oral fixation. On the plus side, it smells like cake batter. (On our first testing day, one Dose.ca editor could smell its yumminess wafting from across the office.) Rating: 3/5” –Leah Collins

“Judging from the hot pink shade visible through the clear plastic tube, I was expecting this one to deposit a lot of colour, but it ended up being nude with sparkles – lots and lots of sparkles. Unless you want to look like a Twilight vamp, this brand is probably not for you. It’s got a shine factor only ‘tweens would love, and it wore off way too easily (or perhaps I just kept licking it off; Leah wasn’t lying about this one smelling/tasting like cake batter). Rating: 2/5” –Jen McDonnell

“I wasn't expecting much from the most inexpensive product of the bunch, but I was pleasantly surprised -- if only for the smell alone. Unfortunately, I found this product required frequent re-application. Rating 3/5” –Miranda Furtado


Sephora Gloss Ultra-Brilliance (Suggested retail price: $14; available at Sephora)

“‘Ultra-brilliance’ might be overdoing it. If you want a mouth that shines like a disco ball (and you do), save your cash and go with the Hard Candy Plexi Gloss. Still, what this Sephora stuff lacks in dazzle, it makes up for in coverage. It applies smoothly and true to its colour -- and is just durable enough to justify a splurge. Rating: 4/5” –Leah Collins

“I really liked the Sephora gloss. I tested a light brown shade, and the colour (though not the shine) managed to last throughout snack-time. I also found this one to be the least sticky of all the glosses I tested – and for any girl who’s ever found her hair glued to her lips, you know how important that can be. Rating: 4/5” –Jen McDonnell

“The Sephora Gloss was my second favourite. It may not have been ‘ultra-brilliant’ but it definitely beat out most of the competition. I loved the smell and the colour; it just didn't have the pop of shine I was looking for. However, when it comes to staying power and coverage, this one was definitely a winner in my books. Rating 4/5” –Miranda Furtado


Smashbox Limitless Long Wear Lip Gloss SPF 15 (Suggested retail price: $24; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“Smashbox: you’ve made me a believer. I've never tried a lip gloss that could survive a coffee break, but this stuff passed the test -- in addition to being the most "poppin" of the bunch in terms of its straight-up glossiness. Have a coffee! Have two! Accidentally get your hair stuck in it, and walk away with your lips still shining! Hallelujah -- or something! Bonus: lightly tinted, this one's perfect to wear on its own, or over your lipstick. Rating: 4.5/5” –Leah Collins

“This one was the best of the bunch. It delivered both long-lasting colour and shine, and featured my favourite applicator (a longer-than-normal felt sponge). Plus, it contains SPF 15 to keep my pout protected. Rating: 5/5” –Jen McDonnell

“I found it to be thick and moisturizing with that perfect hint of colour for a great daytime look -- or paired with my current lipstick for extra shine. It was a little thicker than I’d like, but it made up for it by lasting throughout my lunch break. Rating 4.5/5 –Miranda Furtado
